q:
In Machine Learning, you are given the following three figures. Which of these set of statements about these figures is correct?

Figure 1

Figure 2

Figure 3

Statements

  1. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then remains constant after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is no change in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c) Figure 3—Boxplots displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.
  2. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then decreases after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is a slow but steady increase of approximately $ 10,000 in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c) Figure 3—Violin plot displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.
  3. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then decreases after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is an exponential increase of approximately $ 10,000 in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c) Figure 3—Boxplots displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.
  4. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then decreases after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is a flow but a steady increase of approximately $ 10,000 in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c)Figure 3—Boxplots displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.

You are given the following 'Salary.csv' file that contains six columns. You imported this file into a dataset variable.

You want to obtain the provided graph. Which of these codes can be used to obtain this? 

Salary.csv

Graph

Codes

  1. dataset[[ 'phd', 'service' ]].head(10).plot.bar()
  2. dataset[['phd', 'service']].head(10).plot.bar(title="Ph.D. Vs Service\n 2018")
  3. dataset[['service', 'phd']].plot.bar(title="Ph.D. Vs Service\n 2018")
  4. dataset[['service', 'phd']].head(10).plot.box(title="Ph.D. Vs Service\n 2018")
In Machine Learning, you are given p variables in your dataset. Determine the number of distinct scatterplots that can be created in this scenario.

You are given the following graph. Which of the following statements about this graph are correct:

Graph

Statements

  1. This graph represents a scatter plot and denotes a linear relationship between tip and total_bill.
  2. This graph represents a joint plot and denotes a linear relationship between tip and total_bill.
  3. tip is left-skewed, whereas total_bill is right-skewed.
  4. tip is right-skewed, whereas total_bill is left-skewed.
